title: Meet Basic Eligibility Requirements
description: For Cabin Crew, the minimum is G.C.E. O/L with a credit pass in English. For pilots, A/L in the Maths stream is required. Key requirements include meeting age, height, and medical fitness standards. Strong swimming ability is mandatory for crew.

title: Cabin Crew Training OR Pilot Training
description: Cabin Crew: Successfully apply to an airline and undergo their intensive initial training program (typically 3-4 months). Pilot: Enroll in a flight school to obtain your Private Pilot License (PPL) and Commercial Pilot License (CPL) with relevant ratings. This is a significant financial investment.
qualifications: CPL with Instrument Rating (IR) and Frozen ATPL
institutes: Flight schools (e.g., Asian Aviation Centre, Fairway Aviation Academy)

title: Junior Cabin Crew / First Officer (Co-pilot)
description: Cabin Crew: Begin flying as a junior crew member, focusing on safety and service delivery. Pilot: After obtaining your CPL, join an airline as a Cadet Pilot or First Officer on a specific aircraft type (e.g., Airbus A320), which requires further 'Type Rating' training.

title: Senior Cabin Crew / Senior First Officer
description: Cabin Crew: Progress to a senior role, taking on more responsibility for specific cabin zones and mentoring junior crew. Pilot: Gain more flight hours and experience, becoming a proficient and reliable First Officer, ready for the next step.

title: Cabin Manager (Purser) / Captain
description: Cabin Crew: Advance to the role of Cabin Manager, leading the entire cabin crew team and being responsible for all in-flight service and safety. Pilot: After meeting extensive flight hour and experience requirements, undergo rigorous training to upgrade to the rank of Captain, taking ultimate command of the aircraft.
